string-array.name: lessons
string-array.item: In this life, when you deny someone an apology, you will remember it at time you beg forgiveness.
Short cuts make long delays.
No matter how hard you kick, no matter how high you get, you can\'t go all the way around.
But one of the big lessons I have learned from my journey is you can\'t please everyone, so don\'t try.
You can\'t wait around for something to become good, it either is, or isn\'t.
I am not someone who is ashamed of my past. I\'m actually really proud. I know I made a lot of mistakes, but they, in turn, were my life lessons.
Mistakes are a part of being human. Appreciate your mistakes for what they are: precious life lessons that can only be learned the hard way.
Your time is limited, so don\'t waste it living someone else\'s life.
Life is inherently risky. There is only one big risk you should avoid at all costs, and that is the risk of doing nothing.
You get in life what you have the courage to ask for.
Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
A great attitude becomes a great day which becomes a great month which becomes a great year which becomes a great life.
You can\'t live your life for other people. You\'ve got to do what\'s right for you, even if it hurts some people you love.
Don\'t let anyone ever make you feel like you don\'t deserve what you want.
We are who we choose to be.
After a while, you learn to ignore the names people call you and just trust who you are.
I didn\'t get there by wishing for it or hoping for it, but by working for it.
I can accept failure, everyone fails at something. But I cannot accept not trying.
In every success story, you will find someone who has made a courageous decision.
If there are things you don\'t like in the world you grew up in, make your own life different.
We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give.
In three words I can sum up everything I\'ve learned about life: it goes on.
The hardest thing to learn in life is which bridge to cross and which bridge to burn.
Things turn out best for those who make the best of the way things turn out.
Mistakes are part of the dues one pays for a full life.
Good judgment comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgment.
